circumstances: The twin engine airplane departed Oklahoma City Airport in the late morning on a local check-out flight. En route, the pilot became lost and disoriented, causing the aircraft to fly to the south for few hours until it went low on fuel. The pilot ditched the airplane off New Orleans. A passenger was slightly injured while two other occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
Ditching after the pilot became lost and disoriented. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Improper in-flight decisions, 
- Fuel exhaustion, 
- Ditching site 835 SM from departure point.
